Description: Fragment of a limestone trial-piece; remains of royal figures in relief and incised grids on both sides. Sculpture model. Thin limestone plaque with incised grid (ca. 1.1/1.2 cm side). Fragment. 2 male figures, standing. On one side, man with kilt (grid still visible on kilt), holding vase in his hand; low-relief. Other side: pharaoh wearing kilt and bull tail, ankh sign in his hand, striding pose; carved out relief grid still visible on almost all surface. Only left side preserved, broken to the right, above and bottom.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CA.09)
